description: Distance from n! to the nearest prime.
links: Hans Havermann, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000
example: For both 1! and 2! the nearest prime neighbor is 2, with distances of 1 and 0, respectively. The nearest primes around 8! are 40289 and 40343 with distances of 31 and 23, so a(8)=23.
maple: with(numtheory): [seq(min(nextprime(i!)-i!,i!-prevprime(i!)),i=3..100)]; # a(1) and a(2) computed individually
crossrefs: Cf. A006990, A037151, A033932, A033933, A053714 (signed version with a different second term).
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jan 19 2001
